newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Chase Manhattan to cut Bahrain operations.
newsitem.headline: Chase Manhattan to cut Bahrain operations.

text.p: Chase Manhattan Bank, a Bahrain-based offshore banking unit (OBU), said on Monday it would move control of its dealing room to London from Manama.
"The bank is moving dealing room control to London from Bahrain and cutting its staff," a bank official told Reuters.
He said a single dealer would man the Bahrain dealing room as of the end of July, down from six. The island state is the Gulf's main financial and banking centre.
The Chase OBU, part of Chase Manhattan Corp of the United States, did not say why it was making the move but bankers said lack of business could be among the main reasons.
Earlier on Monday investment bank Okasan International E.C., 51 percent owned by Okasan Securities of Japan, said it was liquidating its Bahrain office from July 1.
"Shareholders of Okasan International have decided at an extraordinary meeting to voluntarily liquidate the company from July 1," a bank official told Reuters.
"The secondary market has not been good in the past seven years, prompting the closure of the bank...The company is not existing any more (in Bahrain)," he added.
Banque Indosuez, a Bahrain-based OBU, closed its treasury department at the end of 1996 and Swiss Bank Corp (SBC) closed its Bahrain OBU in 1996.
